meanings.definition: To look or stare angrily or sullenly
meanings.sent1: She would often glower at her brother when he teased her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher glowered at the students who were talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: Despite his attempt to hide it, his glower gave away his frustration.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to glower down upon the small town.
meanings.sent5: His glower was so intense that it made everyone in the room uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: Her glower made it clear she was not in the mood to talk.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide his glower of disappointment when he saw the results.
meanings.sent3: The cat's glower at the empty food bowl was both amusing and pitiful.
meanings.sent4: The old painting captured a haunting glower that seemed to follow you.
meanings.sent5: The glower on his face was like a dark cloud overshadowing the room.
